text: Vladimir Silađi (; born 23 April 1993) is a Serbian professional footballer who plays as a forward for TSC Bačka Topola. ==Career== After coming through the youth academy of Vojvodina, Silađi made his first-team debut for the club on 7 May 2011, coming on as a substitute for Giorgi Merebashvili in a 1–1 away draw with Borac Čačak. In early 2016, Silađi moved to Serbian League Vojvodina side TSC Bačka Topola. He helped the club win promotion to the Serbian First League in 2017 and eventually to the Serbian SuperLiga in 2019. ==Honours== ;TSC Bačka Topola * Serbian First League: 2018–19 ===Individual=== * Serbian SuperLiga Top Scorer: 2019–20 (16 goals, shared with Nenad Lukić and Nikola Petković) ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Association football forwards Category:FK ČSK Čelarevo players Category:FK Proleter Novi Sad players Category:FK Sloga Temerin players Category:FK Timok players Category:FK TSC Bačka Topola players Category:FK Vojvodina players Category:Serbian First League players Category:Serbian footballers Category:Serbian people of Hungarian descent Category:Serbian SuperLiga players Category:Sportspeople from Novi Sad Category:1993 births Category:Living people
title: Vladimir Silađi
